availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Lawrence County farmer and lumberman. Wayne County, Virginia native. Married Jane Chambers Vinson in 1835. Father of Richard Vinson, Zariah Vinson Johnson, Tennessee Vinson, Zutto Cushing Vinson, Mary J. Vinson, and Pharaoh Vinson. Representative in the Virginia House of Delegates from 1853 to 1854. Colonel of the Fourteenth Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment from 1861 to c1862.

bibl.p: E. Polk Johnson, A History of Kentucky and Kentuckians: The Leaders and Representative Men in Commerce, Industry, and Modern Activities, Volume 3 (Chicago, IL: Lewis Publishing Company, 1912), p. 1507. “William Oliver Vinson,” Find A Grave, memorial no. 83483248. William Vinson, “Letter, William Vinson to Wife and Children, Richmond Va., January 28, 1854 (Ms2008-048),” VT Special Collections Online, accessed January 27, 2017, https://digitalsc.lib.vt.edu/Appalachia/Ms2008-048VinsonWilliamLetter_1854. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Virginia, Wayne County, District 66, p. 266. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, Louisa, p. 145. Kentucky Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates (1911-1955), Ancestry, 1919, Lawrence County, file no. 19059.
